Q0.reasoning: Patient clinical info explicitly states whole genome sequencing (WGS) has been ordered.

Q1.reasoning: Policy age-based criteria apply to individuals <18 for evaluation of unexplained neurodevelopmental disorders; patient is 13, which meets the <18 requirement (see Policy II.1).

Q2.reasoning: Policy (II.1.a) requires evaluation by an ABMGG board-certified medical geneticist or an ABGC board-certified genetic counselor; the record notes evaluation by a developmental pediatrician and pre-test counseling but does not specify the counselor’s ABGC/ABMGG credentials, so provider requirement compliance cannot be confirmed from available info.

Q3.reasoning: Policy limits coverage of WGS to situations where WES was performed and unable to identify a causative mutation and the WES criteria are met (II.4). The patient has not had prior WES documented, so the medical indication for WGS per policy is not met.

Q4.reasoning: Policy requires WES (and comparator analysis) prior to WGS when WES is nondiagnostic (II.4). The patient has only had nondiagnostic FISH; no prior WES is documented.

Q5.reasoning: Patient has a relevant family history (an aunt with dysmorphic features). The policy recognizes family history as relevant to assessing a likely genomic etiology in genetic testing contexts (multiple sections discussing family history and inherited phenotypes).

Q6.reasoning: Policy requires pre-test counseling by an ABMGG geneticist or ABGC genetic counselor for WES/WGS indications (II.1.a). The record states pre-test genetic counseling was completed but does not document the counselor’s ABGC credential, so compliance cannot be confirmed.

Q7.reasoning: The provided policy document does not list or map specific CPT codes to WGS/WES testing; no CPT guidance is present in the text.

Q8.reasoning: Under the policy WGS MEETS COVERAGE CRITERIA only when WES has been performed and failed to identify a causative mutation and all relevant WES criteria are met (II.4). Because no prior WES is documented for this patient, the requested WGS is not covered per policy.
